column4: It doesn't even say anything in /var/log/proftpd !   wtf!  no logging on a "421" denied error ??????  how is that even possible that it errors and doesn't log ?
Seriously out of everybody here no one has had a "421" problem with ftp servers???
You are getting a 421 error when connecting to ftp servers or...?
I installed pro-ftpd on a server, and I can't connec to localhost
did you install as standalone or identd?
inetd, but I have tried both in the .conf file
I then install xinetd, which didn't do anything
if I try to execute xinetd it says its not installed, I removed the package
you need that package installed if you installed proftpd to run under inetd
I install it and run and then it says it can't start in either indetd or standalone mode
oh thank god, ok - dpkg-reconfigure proftpd -> standalone, and installed xinetd and its accepting connections
I'm on a tough time schedule.. sorry for the brashness
xinetd is basically a service that runs to detect connections on a port and runs a deamon on the fly to accept the connections according to the configuration you have for it

I must usually select standalone, but selected inetd this time for some reason.  I'll just make sure to always select "standalone" for now on.  I didn't think dpkg-recongiure would do anything because I changed the .conf file to "standalone" and that didn't work
xinetd does have it's benifits. You should look it up to see if it suits your neeeds :)
